intro: Pagameopsis maguirei subsp. pusillus, commonly known as the dwarf pagameopsis, is a rare and small herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red or pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare species with conservation concerns.
